means: 使人尴尬地，使人为难地，使人难堪地

sentence.Network_en: Stephens had beaten him embarrassingly easily.
sentence.Network_cn: 斯蒂芬斯轻松击败了他，让他颜面尽失。

sentence.Network_en: The lyrics of the song are embarrassingly banal.
sentence.Network_cn: 那首歌的歌词非常老套，令人难堪。

sentence.Network_en: I have caught the sun and have an embarrassingly glowing red nose.
sentence.Network_cn: 我晒黑了,还有一个难堪的红鼻子.

令人尴尬的，令人为难的embarrassingly adv. 使人为难地；使人窘迫地Col. 1) be embarrassed by 由于…感到为难
令人尴尬的，令人为难的embarrassingly adv. 使人为难地；使人窘迫地Col. 1) be embarrassed by 由于…感到为难
embarrassed 觉得不好意思的，困惑的embarrassingly 使人尴尬地，使人窘迫的embarrassment 困窘，困惑，难堪

list.abs: ...是在使用者同时执行多种个别的程序，或当执行的程序“不易平行”(embarrassingly parallel)时--换言之，就是当某项任务附带许多自然.
实际上，很少应用是同时并行(embarrassingly parallel)的。就像Madden提及，图像和多媒体处理是同时并行的，但是这些应用已经有 …

entry.tran: 令人害羞的;让人难堪的;令人尴尬的
entry.def: Something that is embarrassing makes you feel shy or ashamed.

example.ex: That was an embarrassing situation for me...
Men find it embarrassing to be honest.
example.tran: 实话实说让男人觉得难为情。

entry.def: Something that is embarrassing to a public figure such as a politician or an organization such as a political party causes problems for them.

example.ex: He has put the Bonn government in an embarrassing position...
example.tran: 他将波恩政府置于窘地。

example.ex: The speech was deeply embarrassing to Cabinet ministers.
example.tran: 这席话让内阁大臣们非常难堪。

sentences.sentence: "the great man was embarrassingly humble and self-effacing"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He felt suddenly, embarrassingly, close to tears.

auth_sentence.content: Do not be afraid of embarrassingly obvious answers.
